careers.title: Software Engineer
careers.description: Designs, develops, and maintains software applications. Involves coding, debugging, and collaborating with teams to build and improve software products.

high_school: AP Computer Science A/Principles
Join a coding club or robotics team
Build personal projects (websites, simple games)
undergrad: Pursue a Computer Science or Software Engineering degree
Secure software development internships
Contribute to open-source projects on GitHub

careers.title: UX Designer
careers.description: Focuses on creating user-friendly and intuitive digital products. Involves user research, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing to enhance user satisfaction.

high_school: Take art and design classes
Learn design tools like Figma or Canva
Practice redesigning your favorite apps
undergrad: Study Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Graphic Design, or Psychology
Build a strong portfolio of design projects
Complete a UX design internship

careers.title: Data Scientist
careers.description: Analyzes large, complex data sets to identify trends and make predictions. Uses statistical methods, machine learning, and data visualization to provide actionable insights.

high_school: AP Statistics and AP Computer Science
Participate in math or data-focused competitions
Learn Python and basic data analysis libraries
undergrad: Major in Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Participate in Kaggle competitions
Gain experience with real datasets through projects or internships

careers.title: Cyber Security Analyst
careers.description: Protects an organization's computer networks and systems from cyber threats. Involves monitoring for security breaches, investigating violations, and implementing security measures.

high_school: Join a cybersecurity or IT club
Participate in Capture The Flag (CTF) competitions
Learn basic networking concepts and Linux
undergrad: Major in Cybersecurity, IT, or Computer Science
Earn entry-level certifications like CompTIA Security+
Seek internships in IT or security roles

careers.title: Cloud Architect
careers.description: Oversees a companyâ€™s cloud computing strategy. This includes cloud adoption plans, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring.

high_school: Learn the basics of major cloud providers (AWS, Azure)
Understand networking fundamentals
Get familiar with Linux command line
undergrad: Major in IT, Cloud Computing, or Computer Science
Obtain cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Cloud Practitioner)
Work on projects that deploy applications to the cloud

careers.title: Music Producer
careers.description: Oversees the creation of a song or album. They guide the artist, manage the recording process, and shape the final sound of the music.

high_school: Join band or orchestra; take music theory classes
Learn a Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) like GarageBand or FL Studio
Start producing and sharing your own music
undergrad: Study Music Production, Audio Engineering, or a related field
Intern at a recording studio
Collaborate with local artists to build a portfolio

careers.title: Research Scientist
careers.description: Conducts scientific experiments and analysis in a lab or academic setting to advance knowledge in a particular field like biology, chemistry, or physics.

high_school: Excel in AP Science courses (Biology, Chemistry, Physics)
Participate in science fairs or research competitions
Seek opportunities to volunteer or assist in a university lab
undergrad: Major in a specific science (e.g., Biology, Chemistry)
Gain extensive undergraduate research experience in a professor's lab
Co-author a research paper or present at a conference

careers.title: Marketing Manager
careers.description: Develops and executes marketing strategies to promote a product or service. They manage campaigns, analyze market trends, and oversee a marketing team.

high_school: Join a business or DECA club
Start a blog or social media account on a topic you're passionate about
Learn the basics of digital marketing online
undergrad: Major in Marketing, Business, or Communications
Get internships in marketing roles
Build a portfolio of marketing campaigns you've worked on

careers.title: Registered Nurse
careers.description: Provides and coordinates patient care, educates patients and the public about various health conditions, and provides advice and emotional support.

high_school: Take anatomy, biology, and chemistry
Volunteer at a hospital or clinic
Get certified in CPR and First Aid
undergrad: Complete a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree
Pass the NCLEX-RN exam
Gain clinical experience through required rotations

careers.title: High School Teacher
careers.description: Educates students in a specific subject area. Involves creating lesson plans, grading assignments, and mentoring students to prepare them for college and beyond.

high_school: Excel in the subject you wish to teach
Tutor or mentor younger students
Volunteer in a classroom or with youth groups
undergrad: Major in the subject you want to teach and complete a teacher education program
Complete student teaching requirements
Pass state licensing exams
